dataset.title: Bonanza Creek Experimental Forest: Hourly Precipitation data, 1988 to Present

address.deliveryPoint: Forest Soils Laboratory University of Alaska Fairbanks O'Neill Bldg

abstract.para: Precipitation is measured at many sites within BCEF using TE525 tipping buckets. These sensors are able to detect .254mm of precipitation and record hourly totals of rainfall or throughfall. It should be noted the tipping buckets within forested sites are subject to clogging by forest debris whcih can result in under reporting of rain events as well as over reporting upon release of the collected precipitation. There is data from floodplains to upland sites along a range of successional gradients.

section.title: Access to Data
section.para: While metadata will be freely available to those requesting it, the data manager will assure that any restrictions on access to data sets in the database will be enforced. Data will not be released without proper permission first being obtained from the investigator who generated the data.

section.title: Use of data
section.para: Researchers should receive adequate acknowledgment for the use of their data by others and should be provided with copies of publications using their data. Users of data from the data base must be aware that data is not to be sold or redistributed.

section.title: Citing Bonanza Creek LTER Datasets
section.para: It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists. Thus, the Data User will properly cite the Data Set in any publications or in the metadata of any derived data products that were produced using the Data Set.

section.title: corrections
section.para: All records between October to April of a given year should be used with caution.

section.title: Methods
section.para: Sites included in this dataset are LTER1 and LTER2. 1989 - 1995 Data were recorded with Omnidata easyloggers. Data were recorded with a Campbell 21X datalogger after 1994. Precipitation was recorded with the following sensors: Summer: Sierra misco tipping bucket Winter: Belfort weighing bucket, a mixure of antifreeze,methanol and mineral oil is used to convert snow into liquid form and to prevent evaporation.
